info.description: The Jemstep Digital Advice Platform API allows third party developers to build applications or customized solutions that enable digital wealth management.
info.title: Jemstep Digital Advice Platform API

license.name: Copyright Jemstep, Inc - All Rights Reserved

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: The Accounts resource provides methods that allow you to create, delete, and manage investor accounts.

tags.name: Account Applications
tags.description: The Account Applications resource provides methods that allow you to create new account applications.

tags.name: Supporting Documentation
tags.description: The Supporting Documentation resource provides methods to provide supporting documentation.

tags.name: Allocations
tags.description: The Allocations resource provides methods which allow you to create, delete and manage Allocations which may be linked to accounts

tags.name: Oauth2
tags.description:
Use these endpoints to:

* Get an access_token in order to call an API. You can, optionally, retrieve an id_token and a refresh_token as well.
* Refresh your access token, using a refresh token you got during authorization.
* Retrieve information related to your token

tags.name: Profile
tags.description: Use these endpoints to retrieve user profile information

tags.name: Content Upload
tags.description: The Content Upload resource provides methods that allow you to create, delete, and manage content.

tags.name: Financial Analytics
tags.description: The Financial Analytics resource provides methods that allow you to perform calculations and simulations.

tags.name: Goals
tags.description: A Goal represents the intent of an investment, e.g., retirement, wealth creation, education, etc.  The Goals resource provides methods that allow you to create, delete, and manage investor goals.

tags.name: Investors
tags.description: The Investor resource provides methods that allow you to create, delete, and manage investors.

tags.name: Questionnaire
tags.description: Questionnaire resource provides methods to create or update questionnaires for investors.

tags.name: Households
tags.description: The Household resource provides methods that allow you to create, delete, and manage households

tags.name: Organizations
tags.description: The Organizations resource provides methods that allow you to create, delete, and manage your organizations.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: The Messages resource allows you to maintain organization messages

tags.name: EventStream
tags.description: The EventStream resource allows you to subscribe to the real-time stream of user and application events

tags.name: Questionairre
tags.description: The Questionairre resource allows you to maintain questionairre metadata

tags.name: Strategy
tags.description: The Strategy resource provides methods that allow you to create, delete, and manage investor strategy.

tags.name: Model
tags.description: A model is the composition of a portfolio by ticker

tags.name: Program
tags.description: A collection of model series

tags.name: Series
tags.description: A model series is a collection of models

tags.name: Ticker
tags.description: A ticker is a unique identifier for a publicly traded stock

tags.name: Utility
tags.description: The Utility resource provides various miscellaneous utility functions

post.summary: Perform a projection to establish sustainable spend for a goal.
post.description: Sustainable spend is the amount that can be spent per year in the decumulation period of an investment. For example in retirement this would be the amount that the investor could withdraw annually without running out.

requestBody.description: Required parameters for performing a goal projection

post.summary: Perform a projection for desired spend toward a goal
post.description: Desired spend is the amount specified by an investor that they want to withdraw in decumulation. This projection can find the probability that this amount is sustainable.

requestBody.description: Required parameters for performing a goal projection

openIdConnect.description:
Jemstep secures it's API endpoints using OpenID Connect. OpenID Connect 1.0 is a simple identity layer on top of the OAuth 2.0 protocol. It allows Clients to verify the identity of the End-User based on the authentication performed by an Authorization Server, as well as to obtain basic profile information about the End-User in an interoperable and REST-like manner.
OpenID Connect allows clients of all types, including Web-based, mobile, and JavaScript clients, to request and receive information about authenticated sessions and end-users. The specification suite is extensible, allowing participants to use optional features such as encryption of identity data, discovery of OpenID Providers, and session management, when it makes sense for them [OpenID Foundation http://openid.net/connect/ ].

> For more information see OpenID Connect Core 1.0 incorporating errata set 1 [http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html ]

[Recommended Authentication Mechanisms](#recommended-authentication-mechanisms)
-----

Jemstep makes use of a [Certified OpenID Provider](http://openid.net/developers/certified/) to support the various OpenID Connect flows. It is highly recommended that you use a certified relying party library when authentication against Jemstep's APIs. Relying Party clients can obtain the information needed to interact with the Jemstep OpenID Provider by accessing the [configuration endpoint](https://loginqa.jemstep.com/.well-known/openid-configuration).

The type of application you are building will impact your choice of OpenId Connect flow to use:

Application | OIDC/OAuth Flow | Recommended Relying Party Library
--- | --- | ---
__Web Application (with dedicated server-side component)__ | OIDC Authorization Code Flow | https://github.com/nov/openid_connect
__Desktop Native Application__ | OIDC Authorization Code Flow | https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient2
__Mobile Native Application__ | OIDC Authorization Code Flow | https://appauth.io/
__Javascript Application (single page application)__ | OIDC Implicit Code Flow | https://github.com/IdentityModel/oidc-client-js/
__Javascript Application (with dedicated server-side component)__ | OIDC Implicit Code Flow | https://github.com/panva/node-openid-client
__Service Integration__ | OAuth 2.0 JWT Bearer Token Flow | Proprietary. See [Developer Account Quickstart](#developer-account-quickstart) for further details.

Jemstep supports [Dynamic Client Registration](#dynamic-client-registration) which allows client to register themselves.

[Dynamic Client Registration](#dynamic-client-registration)
----

Dynamic Application Registration enables you to register applications (clients) dynamically. These applications can be either first-party or third-party applications.
This feature is based on the [OpenID Connect Dynamic Client Registration specification](https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-registration-1_0.html). The supported client options are available at the [configuration endpoint](https://loginqa.jemstep.com/.well-known/openid-configuration).

The following request will create a new client that may be used to build a single page application:

```
POST /oxauth/restv1/register HTTP/1.1
Host: loginqa.jemstep.com
Content-Type: application/json
Cache-Control: no-cache

{
 "application_type": "web",
 "redirect_uris":
   ["https://example.com/cb"],
 "client_name": "Example Implicit Client for SPA",
 "subject_type": "pairwise",
 "response_types" : ["id_token", "token"],
 "grant_types" : ["implicit"],
 "token_endpoint_auth_method": "client_secret_basic",
 "contacts": ["example@example.com"]
}
```

A successful response will result in the following:

```
{
  "client_id": "@!18AD.F291.96C6.D368!0001!BB5B.54AF!0008!03AD.B4BB.F9D1.F876",
  "client_secret": "f91ffaa6-d9ab-4aeb-b492-6dea5360ae9c",
  "registration_access_token": "b7591d9b-7eb2-4794-886c-8e61229353d6",
  "registration_client_uri": "https://loginqa.jemstep.com/oxauth/restv1/register?client_id=@!18AD.F291.96C6.D368!0001!BB5B.54AF!0008!03AD.B4BB.F9D1.F876",
  "client_id_issued_at": 1524538961,
  "client_secret_expires_at": 1524625361,
  "redirect_uris": [
      "https://example.com/cb"
  ],
  "response_types": [
      "token",
      "id_token"
  ],
  "grant_types": [
      "implicit"
  ],
  "application_type": "web",
  "contacts": [
      "example@example.com"
  ],
  "client_name": "Example Implicit Client for SPA",
  "subject_type": "pairwise",
  "id_token_signed_response_alg": "RS256",
  "token_endpoint_auth_method": "client_secret_basic",
  "require_auth_time": false,
  "frontchannel_logout_session_required": false,
  "scope": "openid profile uma_protection permission"
}
```

The `registration_access_token` may be used at the Client Configuration Endpoint to perform subsequent operations upon the Client registration.

The client is now available for use in the requested OpenID Flows.

> In order for an organization to consolidate subject identifiers across clients, the `sector_identifier_uri` and pre-registered `redirect_uris` must be provided. Your `sector_identifier_uri` is provided following an approved Developer Account.

> Certain scopes are not be available for dynamic registration.

[Developer Account Quickstart](#developer-account-quickstart)
-----

Developer accounts are required to manage the Organization settings or build service integrations that require user impersonation.

1. Sign up here for a developer account. You must use a valid work email address.
> *Please note, Developer Account review and approval may take up to 48 hours.*
2. Navigate to https://jemstep.github.io/oidc-implicit-flow-sample-javascript and enter your developer account credentials (and complete the 2FA step if required)
3. Following successful authentication, your user's id token, user claims and access token will be presented in the browser
4. Include the access token in the Authorization for all subsequent API requests:
```
GET /userinfo
Authorization: Bearer <Access Token>
```
5. __Jemstep's API endpoints are designed to be executed by the End-User.__ Many organization management endpoints may be invoked by your Developer Account. However, in order for Developer Accounts to perform operations on behalf of your organization's users, a privileged user must log into the application under a different identity. Jemstep's API supports impersonation by issuing ID and access tokens with a subject that differs from the Developer Account. See [OAuth 2.0 JWT Bearer Token Flow](#oauth-jwt-bearer-token-flow) for further details.

[OAuth 2.0 JWT Bearer Token Flow](#oauth-jwt-bearer-token-flow)
----

The OAuth 2.0 JWT bearer token flow defines how a [JSON Web Token](#https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7519) can be used to request an OAuth access token from Jemstep when a client wants to use a previous authorization. Authentication of the authorized app is provided by a digital signature applied to the JWT. The JWT is posted to the OAuth token endpoint, which in turn processes the JWT and issues an access_token based on prior approval of the client. However, the client doesn’t need to have or store a refresh_token, nor is a client_secret required to be passed to the token endpoint.

The JWT bearer token flow has the following requirements:
1. [Register a Service Integration Client](#register-a-service-integration-client)
2. [Create a JWT Bearer Token](#create-a-jwt-bearer-token)
3. [Authenticate using a JWT Bearer Token](#authenticate-using-a-jwt-bearer-token)

[Register a Service Integration Client](#register-a-service-integration-client)
----

Service Integration clients are required to [register](#dynamic-client-registration) with the following attributes:

Attribute | Description
--- | ---        
`token_endpoint_auth_method` | MUST be set to `private_key_jwt`
`subject_type` | MUST be set to `pairwise`
`jwks_uri` | A JWKS or [JSON Web Key Set](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7517) is a set of keys containing the public keys that should be used to verify any JWT issued by an authorization server. By providing a `jwks_uri` the client administrator can perform key rotation on their own schedule.
`jwks` | if a `jwks_uri` is not available, then provide the JWKS directly. See [Generating a JSON Web Key Set](#generating-a-json-web-key-set) for further instructions.
`sector_identifier_uri` | The Organization's `sector_identifier_uri`
`redirect_uris` | One or more of the Organization's pre-registered `redirect_uris`

The following example demonstrates how to register a Service Integration client

```
POST /oxauth/restv1/register HTTP/1.1
Host: loginqa.jemstep.com
Content-Type: application/json
Cache-Control: no-cache

{
   "application_type": "native",
   "redirect_uris":
     ["https://example.com/cb"],
   "client_name": "Example JWT Bearer Client",
   "subject_type": "pairwise",
   "response_types" : ["code", "id_token", "token"],
   "grant_types" : ["authorization_code", "implicit"],
   "sector_identifier_uri": "https://loginqa.jemstep.com/...<truncated for privacy>",
   "token_endpoint_auth_method": "private_key_jwt",
   "jwks": "{\"keys\":[{\"kty\":\"RSA\",\"n\":\"xHoinVy7hW3Ye-CeDRAvEiFoYP-hgYcLks-kiPTJ7_Jc2ziczSWPKe2ePiBWeonRVlNOVJSfiMINi99qtxzJQpWazbbO7DrORja5KW9UZgoGSIYk1Br7yhV4uaJaxzjJqt2VsyB9_wJw5np4tww9-7uYIaD2PfQd1Y21PhLICt6upDHwWV124tjQjX2hqYSEBjWYopcl4Mx9fxC3YTZ_TkL9xwDt5rPFiBaTS0j_X-lOVyGsF0EyU4OuQowyJxSWAK-IgzMFmqep9OvcgC_t81udyvellAhg3s6VEfSjMCMz6oludk3zTCqcKbftQ_iBDVgirWIjTDAGYmCdNtAX9w\",\"e\":\"AQAB\",\"alg\":\"RS256\",\"kid\":\"52702b87-be48-4892-9882-c882c44056ed\",\"use\":\"sig\"}]}",
   "contacts": ["operations@jemstep.com"]
  }
```

[Generating a JSON Web Key Set](#generating-a-json-web-key-set)
----

> __JSON Web Key (JWKS)__
> A JSON object that represents a cryptographic key. The members of the object represent properties of the key, including its value. [RFC 7517](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7517)

> __JSON Web Key Set (JWKS)__
> A JSON object that represents a set of JWKs. The JSON object MUST have a `keys` member, which is an array of JWKs. [RFC 7517](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7517)

A sample JSON Web Key Set is represented below:
```javascript
{
  "keys": [
    {
      "kty": "RSA",
      "n": "xHoinVy7hW3Ye-CeDRAvEiFoYP-hgYcLk...<truncated>",
      "e": "AQAB",
      "alg": "RS256",
      "kid": "68b6658b-3cbd-44f8-9010-1d586f30e2e2",
      "use": "sig"
    }
  ]
}
```

There are numerous examples online as to how to generate a JWKS from a PEM (Privacy Enhanced Mail) file. In addition Jemstep also provides the following examples:
- Node, https://github.com/jemstep/oauth-jwt-bearer-token-sample
- Java, Coming soon
- Scala, Coming soon

[Create a JWT Bearer Token](#create-a-jwt-bearer-token)
-----

JSON Web Tokens are an open, industry standard [RFC 7519](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7519) method for representing claims securely between two parties. See [JWT.io](https://jwt.io/) for further details. Jemstep's Bearer token requirements are based on the [JSON Web Token (JWT) Profile for OAuth 2.0 Client Authentication and Authorization Grants](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7523)

The following claims are required in order to successfully authenticate using the [OAuth 2.0 JWT Bearer Token Flow](#oauth-jwt-bearer-token-flow):

Required Claim | Description
--- | ---
`iss` | Issuer Identifier for the Issuer of the response. `iss` MUST be the clientId of the [Service Integration Client](#register-a-service-integration-client)
`aud` | Audience(s) that this ID Token is intended for. `aud` MUST be https://loginqa.jemstep.com/oxauth/restv1/token
`sub` | Subject Identifier. `sub` MUST be the clientId of the [Service Integration Client](#register-a-service-integration-client)
`user_sub` | User Subject Identifier. `user_sub` MUST be the username of user who is associated with the [Service Integration Client](#register-a-service-integration-client). Note, until the Jemstep developer portal is available, please contact support@jemstep.com to setup the user/service account association.
`exp` | Expiration time on or after which the ID Token MUST NOT be accepted for processing. The processing of this parameter requires that the current date/time MUST be before the expiration date/time listed in the value.
`iat` | Time at which the JWT was issued. Its value is a JSON number representing the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the date/time.

In addition to the The following optional claims are also supported:

Optional Claim | Description
--- | ---
`impersonated_sub` | Impersonated Subject Identifier. `impersonated_sub` MAY be the username or the external identifier of the target user to impersonate. If the username or external identifier is not found, then a new user is created. The following claims are applicable to the `user_sub` or `impersonated_sub` if provided
`given_name` | Given name(s) or first name(s)
`family_name` | Surname(s) or last name(s)
`middle_name` | Middle name(s)
`picture` | Profile picture URL
`email` | Preferred e-mail address
`gender` | Gender
`birthdate` | Birthday
`zoneinfo` | Time zone
`phone_number` | Preferred telephone number
`address` | Preferred postal address
`updated_at` | Time the information was last updated
`claims` | Custom claims that are not listed above and included in [JSON Web Token Claims](https://www.iana.org/assignments/jwt/jwt.xhtml)

The header must include the neccessary details for verifying the token:

Header | Description
--- | ---
`typ` | `JWT` 
`alg` | `RS256` or the specific algorithm during client registration
`kid` | The identifier of the public key as provided in the [JSON Web Key Set](#generating-a-json-web-key-set) at client registration

A valid JWT will look similar to:

```
header {
  "alg": "RS256",
  "typ": "JWT",
  "kid": "52702b87-be48-4892-9882-c882c44056ed"
}
payload: {
  "user_sub": "example_user",
  "iat": 1524544833,
  "exp": 1524552033,
  "aud": "https://loginqa.jemstep.com/oxauth/restv1/token",
  "iss": "@!18AD.F291.96C6.D368!0001!BB5B.54AF!0008!3DD3.8390.0CAA.C608",
  "sub": "@!18AD.F291.96C6.D368!0001!BB5B.54AF!0008!3DD3.8390.0CAA.C608"
}
```

A signed token (assertion) will look similar to:
```
eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCIsImtpZCI6IjUyNzAyYjg3LWJlNDgtNDg5Mi05ODgyLWM4ODJjNDQwNTZlZCJ9.eyJ1c2VyX3N1YiI6Im1hdHRoZXczIiwiaW1wZXJzb25hdGVkX3N1YiI6InRlc3QiLCJzY29wZSI6WyJvcGVuaWQiXSwiaWF0IjoxNTI0NTQ0ODMzLCJleHAiOjE1MjQ1NTIwMzMsImF1ZCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vbG9naW5xYS5qZW1zdGVwLmNvbS9veGF1dGgvcmVzdHYxL3Rva2VuIiwiaXN..<truncated>
```

[Authenticate using a JWT Bearer Token](#authenticate-using-a-jwt-bearer-token)
----

Once the [Service Integration Client has been registered](#register-a-service-integration-client) and the [JWT Bearer Token created](#create-a-jwt-bearer-token), the token should be presented to the JWT Bearer token endpoint. The following example will successfully authenticate the user:

```
POST /jwt/token HTTP/1.1
Host: loginqa.jemstep.com
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Cache-Control: no-cache

grant_type=client_credentials&client_id=%40!18AD.F291.96C6.D368!0001!BB5B.54AF!0008!3DD3.8390.0CAA.C608&client_assertion_type=urn%3Aietf%3Aparams%3Aoauth%3Aclient-assertion-type%3Ajwt-bearer&client_assertion=eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCIsImtpZCI6IjUyNzAyYjg3LeyJ1c2VyX3N1YiI6Im1hdHRoZXczIiwiaW1wZX..<truncated>&scope=openid+profile
```

where:

Key | Value
--- | ---
`grant_type` | MUST be `client_credentials` 
`client_id` | The clientId of the Service Integration Client
`client_assertion_type` | MUST be `urn:ietf:params:oauth:client-assertion-type:jwt-bearer`
`client_assertion` | the signed token
`scope` | `Optional`. The requested scopes, space separated

A valid response will have the following structure:

```
{
  "access_token": "1a08b248-a0f2-4941-965c-df4dd49a7cf2",
  "token_type": "bearer",
  "expires_at": 1524545502,
  "id_token": "eyJraWQiOiJhMjg0Y2EyZi1lNTJkLTRhYzEtYTQwZS0wMzdkNGVhYjdlNzciLCJ0eXAiO...<truncated>"
}
```

Use the `access_token` for all subsequent requests. Once the `access_token` expires, generate a new JWT and present to the JWT token endpoint.

> A refresh token is not returned in this flow

oauth2FirstParty.description: First Party Native App authentication facilitated by Resource Owner Password Credentials Grant

oauth2Machine.description: Machine to Machine authentication facilitated by Client Credentials Grant

pageOffset.name: offset
pageOffset.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

pageLimit.name: limit
pageLimit.description: The numbers of items to return.

sort.name: sort
sort.description:
Comma-separated list of fields, in dot-notation, to sort by.
By default the results are returned in ascending order. For descending order, add the 'descending' parameter without a value

descending.name: descending
descending.description: Returns results in descending order. Requires the 'sort' parameter

accountNumber.name: accountNumber
accountNumber.description: The financial institution's unique account number

accountHolderId.name: accountHolderId
accountHolderId.description: The unique id of an account holder

applicationIdsToDelete.name: applicationIds
applicationIdsToDelete.description: A list of unique account application ids

applicationIdsToSubmitOrVerify.name: applicationIds
applicationIdsToSubmitOrVerify.description: A list of unique account application ids

applicationId.name: applicationId
applicationId.description: The unique id of an account application

advisorIds.name: advisorIds
advisorIds.description: Comma-separated list of advisor Ids to search for their investors

modelSeriesId.name: modelSeriesId
modelSeriesId.description: The id of a model series

X-Content-Offset.description: The offset of the current results

X-Content-Link-First.description: Link to the first page of results

X-Content-Link-Last.description: Link to the last page of results

X-Content-Link-Next.description: Link to the next page of results

X-Content-Link-Prev.description: Link to the previous page of results

AccountOwnershipType.description: The type of the account owner.

EntityType.description: List of different types of entities

UpdatedAt.description: Date/time at which this entity was updated.

CreatedAt.description: Date/time at which this entity was created.

financialInstitutionName.description: The name of the financial institution administering this account.

holders.description: A list of the account holders.

beneficiaries.description: A list of the beneficiaries of this account.

goal.description: The URL of the goal that is associated with this account.

developerMessage.example: Verbose, plain language description of the problem for the app developer with hints about how to fix it

userMessage.example: Pass this message on to the app user if needed

example.userMessage: Temporary error saving data. Please try again later
example.developerMessage: Exception occurred while processing accounts for X

successes.description: array of resource ids for successes

failures.description: array of resource ids for failures

completed.description: array of resource ids for successes

incomplete.description: map of resource ids and unanswered questions

Provider.description: The provider of the envelope. Currently can only have the value 'docusign'.

Envelope.description: An object representing a DocuSign envelope.

AccountApplicationStatus.description:
EventTypes:
  * Submitted - Application submitted for processing
  * AccountNumberAllocated - New account number allocated
  * SubmittedToCustodian - Account data submitted to custodian
  * DocumentSigningPending - Waiting for documents to be signed
  * Completed - All data and documents required have been submitted
  * AccountCreated - New account has been created
  * AccountFunded - All funds and positions have been transferred
  * ResubmitNeeded - For some reason this needs to be resubmitted
  * Unknown - The application is in an unknown state

SubmittedAccountApplication.description: Represents an application to create a new account or transfer an existing one. You might think of this as the physical form you would fill out to open an account at a bank.

accountNumber.description: The account number associated with this application.

goalId.description: The ID of the goal associated with the account that will be created.

fundingSources.description: An array of the sources of funding.
An array of the sources of funding.

GrantTypes.description:
Grant Types:
  * client_credentials - Client Credentials Grant
  * password - Resource Owner Password Credentials Grant
  * refresh_token - Refresh Token

base_uri.description: the base uri for this organization, all subsequent requests should use this uri

organization_info.description: the organizations that this client has access to

ProjectionGoal.description: Input data for the (non-retirement) projection goal.

accumulationDuration.description: Duration, in years, during which funds are being accumulated.

decumulationDuration.description: Duration, in years, during which funds are being withdrawn.

investors.description: Data for each investor participating in the projection goal.

age.description: The current age of this investor.

retirementAge.description: The retirement age of this investor.

RetirementProjectionGoal.description: Input data for the retirement projection goal.

ProjectionGoalInputs.description: Input data for the projection goal.

startYear.description: The year of the given tax rate.

rate.description: The tax rate as a floating point number.

GlidePath.description: Represents a period over which a given financial model is in effect.

startYear.description: Year in which the strategy will start to be applied.

modelId.description: The ID of the desired model for this period.

desiredSpendInDecumulation.description: The amount you would like to draw down annually from your goal's accumulated funds.

resultPercentiles.description: A list of the percentiles for which you would like results.

inflationRate.description: The inflation rate as a floating point number.

taxRates.description: Tax rates, as an array of floating point numbers, on a per year basis.

investmentStrategyPeriods.description: An array of objects describing a set of strategy periods. The first element of this array must start at year zero.

percentile.description: A statistical measure which shows, given a set of observations, a certain percentage will fall into a certain range. For example if a desired spend of $1000 is in the 30th percentile, then running a financial goal projection multiple times, 30% of the time the projection result would be $1000 and below.

meanSustainableSpend.description: The amount you would be able to spend in retirement per year without running out of money during your lifetime.

projectedBalances.description: Your savings total at a certain point in time in the future.

ProjectionResults.description: The results of a projection goal calculation.

contributions.description: The contributions necessary for this sustainable spend.

withdrawals.description: The withdrawals allowed for this sustainable spend.

netCashflow.description: The net of contributions and withdrawals.

probabilityOfSuccess.description: The probability, given the data inputs, that you will achieve your "desiredSpendInDecumulation" figure.

investmentStrategyPeriods.description: An array of objects describing a set of strategy periods. The first element of this array must start at year zero.

Goal.description: Represents the intent of an investment, e.g., retirement, wealth creation, education, etc.

enrolled.description: Indicates that account applications for this goal have been completed.

userId.description: The ID of the user associated with this goal.

EventStreamSubscriptionWebhook.description: the webhook to invoke on each event

EventStreamSubscriptionMaxRetries.description: the maximum number of retries before timeout

EventStreamSubscriptionMaxWaitTime.description: the maximum wait time for exponential back-off

EventTypes.description:
EventTypes:
  * trackUserSignupSuccess - Raised when a user signs up for the service
  * trackUserLoginSuccess - Raised when a user logs in successfully
  * trackProfileCreated - Raised when the household is created
  * trackProfileUpdated - Raised when the household is updated
  * trackRTQUpdated - Raised when the RTQ is changed
  * trackAccountAdded - Raised when any account type is added to the user portfolio
  * trackAccountDeleted - Raised when any account type is deleted from the user portfolio
  * trackAddAccountFailure - Raised when there is activity on an account
  * trackAssetLiabilityModelUpdated - Raised when the Asset and Liability Model completes
  * trackStrategyRecommendationUpdated - Raised when the strategy for one or more accounts is updated
  * trackEnrollmentStarted - Raised when the user starts enrollment
  * trackEnrollmentCompleted - Raised when the user starts enrollment
  * trackMoneyMovementEstablished - Raised when a funding source is established
  * trackMoneyMovement - Raised when there is money movement activity
  * trackMoneyMovementDeleted - Raised when a funding source is removed
  * trackAccountOwnerUpdated - Raised when accout owner details change

subscriptionId.description: the subscription id. Automatically assigned by the API

AnswerOption.description: Represents one of multiple answer options, i.e., for a multiple choice question.

label.description: A human-readable description of this answer option.

value.description: The value associated with this answer option.

Question.description: Representation of a question in a questionnaire.

Questionnaire.description: Representation of a questionnaire containing a set of questions.

QuestionnaireAssignment.description: Assigns a set of questionnaire types to this questionnaire.

BadRequest.description: The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax

Unauthorized.description: The requestor is not authorized to consume this resource

Forbidden.description: The requestor is not authorized to consume this resource

NotFound.description: The requested resource was not found

CreatedBatch.description:
The resource or resources were successfully created.
In the case of a single item created, an empty response is returned
in the case of multiple items created, an array of success or failures is returned

UpdatedBatch.description:
The resource or resources were successfully updated.
In the case of a single item created, an empty response is returned
in the case of multiple items created, an array of success or failures is returned

Location.description: the location of the new resource
